content: . 2, Supplementary Fig. 2, only online). Cost-effectiveness of rhythm control medications Patients taking rhythm-control drugs lived an average of 14 QALY, with average lifetime treatments costs of $10745. Among the rhythm-control medications, the cost per QALY for pilsic-ainide was lowest ($638/QALY), while that for amiodarone was highest ($986/QALY). Flecainide, propafenone, and dronedar-one had costs per QALY of $834, $830, and $824/QALY, re-spectively. Sotalol and pilsicainide had incremental cost ($453 and $996) and incremental effectiveness (2 and 3 QALY), dem-onstrating ICER values of $324/QALY and $332/QALY, respec-tively, compared with atenolol
query: cost effectiveness economic analysis amiodarone beta-blockers atrial fibrillation healthcare costs hospitalization reduction
title: Cost-effectiveness of rate- and rhythm-control drugs for treating atrial fibrillation in Korea
authors: Min Kim, Woojin Kim, Changsoo Kim, Boyoung Joung
reference: Kim, M., Kim, W., Kim, C., & Joung, B. (2019). Cost-effectiveness of rate- and rhythm-control drugs for treating atrial fibrillation in Korea. Yonsei Medical Journal, 60(12), 1157-1163. https://doi.org/10.3349/ymj.2019.60.12.1157
